text.text: How do I access the option to post a facility payment in ZOLL Billing?

text:
To access the option to post a facility payment in ZOLL Billing, follow these steps:

1. Log in to the ZOLL Billing system.
2. Click the "Payments" tab.
3. Click the "Facility Payments" link.
4. Enter the amount of the payment and the payment method.
5. Click the "Post Payment" button.

The payment will be posted to the facility's account.

text.text: What information do I need to enter when creating a new transaction for posting a facility payment?

text:
When creating a new transaction for posting a facility payment, you need to enter the following information:

* Deposit date
* Transaction amount
* Payer
* Transaction type
* Transaction number
* Link to claim number

text.text: Can you explain the significance of the deposit date when posting a facility payment?

text: The deposit date is the date the payment will be deposited to your account. Payments are based on the deposit date. For example, if you are posting a payment for a deposit date of October 15th, it will go in the October period until that period is closed.

text.text: What options do I have for selecting the payer when posting a facility payment?

text:
To select the payer when posting a facility payment, you can:

* Type the first three characters of the facility name and select the name that displays.
* Click the Payer field and select the payer type.
* Select the adjustment type - write-off or revenue.

text.text: How do I allocate the payment to specific claims when posting a facility payment?

text:
To allocate the payment to specific claims when posting a facility payment, you can:

1. Click the "Link to claim number" field.
2. Type the claim number and click the "Add" button.
3. Repeat steps 1 and 2 for each claim you want to allocate the payment to.
4. Click the "Post Payment" button.

The payment will be allocated to the selected claims.

text.text: What happens if the payment amount matches exactly with a single invoice in ZOLL Billing?

text: If the payment amount matches exactly with a single invoice in ZOLL Billing, only that invoice will display and the system will automatically allocate the amount to that invoice only.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle cases where the payment amount exceeds or does not exactly match a single invoice?

text: If the payment amount is greater, or does not exactly match that of a single invoice, multiple invoices display. All claims will be grouped under their associated invoice.

text.text: Is it possible to remove an invoice from consideration when posting a facility payment? If so, how?

text: Yes, it is possible to remove an invoice from consideration when posting a facility payment. To do this, you can click the Allocate to this invoice button at the top right. The invoice will gray out and all payments will be set to $ 0.00.

text.text: What actions can I take with individual claims within an invoice when posting a facility payment?

text: There are several things you can do with each claim in an invoice: Full payment: The full amount of the charge was paid. Full denial: If they denied a specific claim within an invoice you can click Full denial. The payment amount changes to $ 0.00 and the claim's status changes to denial. Custom: A window displays under that claim or line item that allows you to enter a custom amount.

text.text: What does it mean to mark a claim as "Full denial" when posting a facility payment?

text: When you mark a claim as "Full denial" when posting a facility payment, it means that the full amount of the charge was denied. This can be done for a variety of reasons, such as if the claim was not covered by insurance or if the patient did not pay their bill. When a claim is marked as "Full denial", the payment amount changes to $ 0.00 and the claim's status changes to denial.

text.text: Can you explain the purpose of the "Custom" option when allocating payments to claims?

text: The Custom option allows you to enter a custom amount when allocating payments to claims. A window displays under that claim or line item that allows you to enter a custom amount.

text.text: How does the "Ignore" button function when posting a facility payment?

text: The Ignore button ignores the claim on the invoice. The charge and new balance remain the same.

text.text: What happens when the transaction amount matches the allocated line items in ZOLL Billing?

text: If the amount you entered exactly matches the charge amount for an invoice, only that invoice displays and the system will automatically allocate the amount to that invoice only. If the amount is greater, or does not exactly match that of a single invoice, multiple invoices display.

text.text: How can I ensure that all necessary payments are properly allocated before posting a facility transaction?

text: After saving the provider level adjustment, your unallocated amount should read $0.00 which will allow you to post the transaction.

text.text: Are there any indicators that help me identify when I can proceed to post a transaction for facility payments?

text: If the accounting period in which the transaction was posted is still open, the transaction will reverse in that period. If not, the adjustment will happen in the next open period.

text.text: What does the green bar at the bottom signify when posting a facility payment in ZOLL Billing?

text: The green bar at the bottom of the screen indicates that the transaction has been posted.

text.text: Can you clarify the process for undoing actions or making adjustments before finalizing a facility payment transaction?

text: To reverse a transaction, you must first reverse the refund on the Claim page and then reverse the transaction. You can reverse a transaction because of insufficient funds, stopped payment, or if it was posted in error.

text.text: Is there any option to review or verify the allocated payments before posting a transaction in Zoll Billing?

text: You can review the unallocated field at the bottom of the screen to make sure it reads 0.00. If it is not zero, you must reconcile the difference. Once the unallocated amount reads zero, you can click Post transaction.

text.text: Are there any limitations or restrictions on the actions I can take while allocating payments to claims?

text: If the amount you entered exactly matches the charge amount for an invoice, only that invoice displays and the system will automatically allocate the amount to that invoice only. If the amount is greater, or does not exactly match that of a single invoice, multiple invoices display.

text: You can find additional resources and support for understanding the facility payment posting process in ZOLL Billing by visiting the Zoll Billing website.

text.text: How to Ignore a claim on facility invoice?

text: To ignore a claim on a facility invoice, you can click the Ignore button. This will keep the charge and new balance the same, and ignore the claim on the invoice.
